Project.Brief history of your project and organi: Magenta is an open-source project that originated from the Brain team in 2016, aimed at exploring the role of machine learning in the creative process, particularly in music and art. Built on TensorFlow, Magenta develops models and tools that allow artists and musicians to collaborate with AI in generating melodies, harmonies, images, and more. While the project started research division, it has since grown into a broader open-source community effort, enabling developers and creatives around the world to experiment with and contribute to the evolving intersection of technology and creativity.
Project.Describe the data being stored onto File: The data to be stored on Filecoin includes a collection of open-source machine learning models, training datasets, pre-trained checkpoints, and creative artifacts such as AI-generated music tracks, MIDI files, and notebooks that demonstrate the use of generative models. These resources used by artists, researchers, and developers, are part of Magenta’s toolkit for music and art creation with machine learning.
Project.How do you plan to prepare the dataset: To store the data, it is first imported and assigned a unique Content Identifier (CID). The data is then broken into segments, encoded, and replicated to ensure durability, and sealed into storage sectors. Storage providers manage the process by handling pre-commitment, sealing, and final commitment stages, and they regularly submit cryptographic proofs to confirm the data’s continued integrity. The CID can later be used to locate, decode, and retrieve the original content.
Project.In which geographies do you plan on maki: Asia other than Greater China, Greater China, Europe, North America
